meta.title: Translation to App Implementation (Design Cards)
meta.description: Design cards that translate teachings into daily app practice. Not doctrinal assertions, but implementation guidance.

cards.title: Daily flow design: morning (align) -> day (action) -> night (reflect)
cards.summary: Assign body, speech, and mind to the morning/day/night flow.
cards.body_md:
App design rule:
- Morning: align the body (posture, movement)
- Day: align speech (words) / choose an action
- Night: reflect on mind

Fixing this structure keeps content clear even as it grows.

micro_practice.morning: Do only the aligning part (short is fine).

reflection_questions: Where did today's loop break? What can you shorten next time?

cards.title: 365-day calendar: use it as a scaffold, not a score
cards.summary: Color is not a score; it is a place to return to.
cards.body_md:
Design policy:
- Do not emphasize consecutive-day counts
- Do not blame gaps
- Tap to return to that day's record

Stay focused on visualization that supports continuation.

micro_practice.day: If you miss a day, simply return the next day.
micro_practice.night: When a color fills in, affirm today's one step and close.

reflection_questions: What does a colored square signal to you?

cards.title: One action per day: restraint sustains
cards.summary: Choose one action to reduce decision fatigue.
cards.body_md:
Design policy:
- One action for today
- Translate it into the smallest step
- Record when done

(Not a doctrinal claim, but a continuity design.)

micro_practice.morning: Decide on just one action for today.
micro_practice.day: Do only the smallest step (even one minute is OK).
micro_practice.night: Write one line about why it did or didn't happen without blame.

reflection_questions: Did you narrow it to one action? If not, why?

cards.title: Night form: one line each for repentance -> vow -> dedication
cards.summary: Split night input into three parts to reduce confusion.
cards.body_md:
Design policy:
1) Repentance: facts (no blame)
2) Vow: one step for tomorrow
3) Dedication: direct toward someone

Based on dictionary definitions, keep input minimal.

micro_practice.night: Write one line each: repentance -> vow -> dedication.

reflection_questions: Is repentance turning into self-denial? Is it grounded in facts?

cards.title: Sources first: every card needs a basis
cards.summary: A minimum quality rule for clear attribution.
cards.body_md:
Operational rule:
- Always attach sources when creating new cards
- Choose sources in order: official -> dictionary -> academic
- Avoid strongly assertive wording

(This is a content quality rule.)

micro_practice.morning: Find sources first for any cards you add today.
micro_practice.day: Fill in sources before writing the body.
micro_practice.night: Check that source links are still live.

reflection_questions: Where can you point to for this explanation?

cards.title: Keep the entry open: protect the beginner's entry
cards.summary: Move difficult terms to the glossary so practice does not stop.
cards.body_md:
Design policy:
- When a difficult term appears, keep reading and supplement via the glossary
- The glossary holds short definitions and sources
- Prioritize practice (action)

(Not a doctrinal claim, but a design policy.)

micro_practice.morning: Do not stop when a difficult term appears (use the glossary).
micro_practice.day: Do not assume you understand; return to action.
micro_practice.night: Check one difficult term in the glossary.

reflection_questions: When you encountered a difficult term, did practice stop or continue?
